title: Highest GDP per Unit of Energy Use
description: In 2023, Ireland achieved a GDP of $50.79 per kg of oil equivalent, showcasing its efficient energy use compared to global standards.

title: Lowest Transport Services in Service Imports
description: Transport services accounted for only 1.47% of Ireland's service imports in 2023, indicating a minimal reliance on this sector.

title: Minimal Losses Due to Theft and Vandalism
description: In 2020, Irish firms reported losses of just 0.5% of annual sales due to theft and vandalism, reflecting a secure business environment.

title: High Value in Other Manufacturing
description: In 2021, 94.33% of Ireland's manufacturing value was attributed to sectors outside textiles and clothing, highlighting a diverse industrial base.

title: Minimal Learning Poverty Among Children
description: In 2021, only 2.33% of children in Ireland were below the minimum reading proficiency at the end of primary school, indicating strong educational outcomes.

title: Extended Primary Education Duration
description: Ireland offers an 8-year primary education program as of 2023, providing a comprehensive foundation for students.

title: Lowest Maternal Mortality Ratio
description: In 2015, Ireland reported a maternal mortality ratio of just 1 per 100,000 live births, showcasing exceptional healthcare standards.

title: Negative Net Primary Income
description: In 2022, Ireland experienced a net primary income deficit of $150.27 billion, indicating more income was paid abroad than received.

title: Decline in Manufacturing Growth
description: In 2023, Ireland's manufacturing sector contracted by 23.93%, reflecting challenges in industrial production.
